details.description: If you're 16 to 19 you might be able to get up to £1,200 from the 16 to 19 Bursary Fund from your school, college or training provider
details.body:
Get help to pay for essential education-related costs if you’re 16 to 19 and in further education or training. You can’t apply if you’re studying at university.

The Bursary Fund can help pay for costs like:

  • equipment you might need for your course
  • lunch
  • transport to and from your school or college

You could get a bursary of £1,200 a year if you’re in one of the following groups:

  • people in care or care leavers
  • people claiming Income Support
  • disabled people getting Employment and Support Allowance and Disability Living Allowance

If you aren’t in one of these groups, you could still get a bursary depending on your personal circumstances. Ask your school, college or training provider’s student support services to see if you’re eligible.

How it’s paid

The bursary is paid directly by your school, college or training provider. They will decide how much and when it’s paid.

How to apply

Speak to your student services or your tutor.

For more information about the 16 to 19 Bursary Fund, download ‘The 16 to 19 Bursary Fund: your questions answered’.

Download ‘The 16 to 19 Bursary Fund: your questions answered’ (PDF, 247KB)
